sub_title: Course Director CfPIE CGTs丨Regulatory & Policy丨Investments Advisor丨EC Expert EV丨EWE Exp Mentor丨Senior Leader on a mission to promote Innovation in Health(care)丨Game changer丨PhD/MBA丨Strategy, Prince2 MGMT Certified丨
summary:
Over 20 years of experience in the pharma/health(care) space. Passionate about Responsible Commercial Innovation to bring new products and services to patients who need them.

Accountable C-suite strategic/operational manager with strong capacity to function in complex environments. Strong business acumen, ability to adopt and perform in diverse ecosystems. Capability to monitor and improve P&L statements (KPIs). Knowledge generalist, (non)calculated risk taker and ‘calm under pressure leader’. Coach, mentor, people developer. Advocate of equality and people wellbeing.

Work experience at various organizations, Synthon BV/Byondis, a global company with total profit of 300 M EU YoY, spending over 20% of GRE on R&D. Provided to the board and CEO broad scientific expertise on different modality therapies against cancer/ auto-immune diseases, regulatory and policy, and input into the portfolio strategic planning & partnerships. 
Built business relations and supported key customers at Future Diagnostics, an IVD MD CRO with outstanding customer base.
Provided advisory services to investors, like Gilde Healthcare, a lower mid-cap buy-out and VC healthcare investor with a cumulative €800 M funds raised, on promising technology platforms and organizational improvements (SMEs).
Education activities at the Avans University of Applied Sciences (ATGM), GLC Europe and The Center for Professional Innovation and Education (CfPIE) offering 300+ pharmaceutical training courses every year  
and 3,500+ Certification Programs.
Involved in Mentoring and Coaching at the European Innovation and Technology, EIT Health MCN Network and EC projects (tenders): Early Warning Europe (EWE) Mentor Academy supported by EISMEA (Experienced Mentor) and The European Network for Health Technology Assessment, EUnetHTA (stakeholder) helping to reshape the future landscape of European HTA. 

Natalia accomplished her PhD at the University of Amsterdam contributing to the field of molecular machines and a post-doc fellowship at ACAS/Medicinal Chemistry Groups at the VU in Amsterdam. She complemented her education with two post-graduate studies in relation to Clinical Trials and European Management/MBA specializing in corporate finance and strategy. 
In addition, she accomplished financial and business administration courses from top tire universities, the Ivy League University of Pennsylvania/The Warton School of Business, the International Rotterdam School of Management/Erasmus University, the University of Geneva and Corporate Finance Institute (CFI).

awards.title: Venture creator and venture builder. Veribio is a blockchain decentralised tracking platform to empower customers and to enhance trust in the food industry
awards.description:
As a consultant and business partner at @BioPharma First Consultancy I secured a first non-dilutive funding of up to 200 K EU and contributed to the creation of a new business: the Veribio venture in the framework of the Next Generation Initiative, a Venture Builder for Human-Centric Solutions.
The following criteria for successful ventures were taken into account: technological innovation, excellence, added value, impact (social, economic benefits), business model, metrics (KPIs), strategy and scalability.
Out of 338 initially accepted applications, Veribio has been selected among 16 innovation projects and will have opportunities to develop the Minimum Viable Product, MVP within the next several months.

awards.title: Member of Board and Secretary of the Dutch Cancer Society
awards.description: As a member of the Dutch Cancer Society (Kanker Wilhelmina Fonds, KWF)  and elected Secretary I represented the KWF organization externally, organized external activities and events to ensure efficient  fundraising processes and a fruitful partnership with the Radboud Oncology Fund.

awards.title: Marathoner
awards.description:
Since the last 3 years I enjoy participating in Marathons in Poland (Cracow) and the Netherlands (Amsterdam) in addition to several half marathons and local competitions. My goal is to increase awareness of climate and war disasters, social injustice and unmet medical needs for oncology patients.
I am involved in fundraising activities to show my support for the Polish Humanitarian Action, PAH and KIKA, the Dutch charity Foundation for children suffering from cancer. The Polish Humanitarian Action, PAH is a non-governmental organisation which operates in Poland and other countries. Its mission is 'to make the world a better place through alleviation of human suffering and promotion of humanitarian values' and human dignity. The Dutch Charity Foundation KIKA, brings in funding for research in childhood cancer.

profile_positions.description: The International Journal of Technology Assessment in Health Care (IJTAHC)/ Cambridge University Press serves as a forum for the wide range of health policy makers and professionals interested in the economic, social, ethical, medical and public health implications of health technology. It covers the development, evaluation, diffusion and use of health technology, as well as its impact on the organization and management of health care systems and public health.
profile_positions.title: Reviewer for the International Journal of Technology Assessment in Health Care

company.name: The Center for Professional Innovation & Education (CfPIE)

profile_positions.company: The Center for Professional Innovation & Education (CfPIE)
profile_positions.description:
The Center for Professional Innovation and Education (CfPIE) is a global organization, offering the widest range of pharmaceutical and medical device certification programs designed for career advancement and professionalization. 34,000+ people have been trained, serving more than 5,500 companies, governmental agencies and non-profit organizations. Over 3,500 professionals have enrolled in Certification Programs to date, with 1,200+ fully completing them. 
As a Course Director I am responsible for the delivery of the highest-quality business services for (bio)pharmaceutical, life science professionals striving to enhance their skills and bring their competencies to the next level.
profile_positions.title: Course Director Cell & Gene Therapy Medicinal Products

profile_positions.description: Involved in the Early Warning Mentor Academy supported by the European Innovation Council and SMEs Executive Agency (EISMEA)  (workshops, education) to upscale innovative products and services, empower mentors and support growth companies (SMEs)
profile_positions.title: Experienced Business Mentor I Ambassador Early Warning Europe Mentor Academy

company.name: EUnetHTA - European Network for Health Technology Assessment

profile_positions.company: EUnetHTA - European Network for Health Technology Assessment
profile_positions.description:
● Advancing cooperation on health technology assessment (HTA)
● Supporting the implementation of the new EU legal framework on HTA (Regulation (EU) 2021/2282
● Contributing to deliverables of the EUnetHTA 21 joint consortium (JCAs/JSCs) (methodological, procedural aspects)
● Providing input to draft documents within the EMA Scientific Advice framework to support Advanced Medicinal Technology Developers:
- Establishing efficacy based on single-arm trials (SATs) submitted as pivotal evidence in a marketing authorisation (MA)' (EMA/CHMP/564424/2021)
- the Council's for International Organizations of Medical Sciences (CIOMS) Working Group XIII Report – RWD/RWE in regulatory decision making 
 - EUnetHTA 21 PC: Briefing Document Template (D6.2.1) & External Guidance with EMA (D6.4.1)

● Assessing applications for funding

profile_positions.title: Expert Evaluator for EC

profile_positions.description:
As a business mentor at EIT Health – the EU Institute of Innovation & Technology, a body of the European Union, I am involved in platform services for top EU start-ups and SMEs. My activities include:
● Participation in selected events embracing several EIT Health programs and external affairs  
● Building strategic public/private ecosystems comprised of various stakeholders (pharma/healthcare industry, public knowledge institutions, academia, financial sectors and governmental organizations)
● Supporting start-ups and their co-founders with issues related to technical/regulatory/governmental aspects, providing valuable business contacts and contributing to overall business growth 
● Involved in strategy & business operations within different CLCs, RISs and projects to ensure transparent communication, efficiency of processes and positive short term/long term organizational outcomes
● Participating in various initiatives enabling to extend collaborations and expose EIT Health to new external/internal stakeholders
● Building value added partnerships with HCPs, reimbursement & HTA bodies, governmental organizations, pharma/health(care) representatives and PE/VC investors (over 150+ business partners)
profile_positions.title: Business Mentor (MCN)

profile_positions.description: Cochrane is a not-for profit organization created over 28 years ago. It constitutes an international network of clinicians, patients, HCPs, carers, researchers, and policy-makers from over 190 countries. Cochrane evidence provides a powerful tool to enhance healthcare knowledge, improve health outcomes and enables non-biased decision-making.
profile_positions.title: Cochrane Community Supporter

company.name: Polish Association for Good Clinical Practice (GCPpl)

profile_positions.company: Polish Association for Good Clinical Practice (GCPpl)
profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Polish Association for Good Clinical Practice in Poland, GCPpl (since 2015), between 2022 - 2023 I was involved in activities of the new created Medical Devices Working Group. I have multiple years of international expertise in the (bio)pharmaceutical product development life cycle where clinical trials play a pivotal role in successful 'go-to-market' strategies.  I offered my experience in healthcare systems innovation and my support to the group in terms of in vitro medical devices, biomarkers and combination products with emphasis on novel therapeutical solutions/regulatory issues for selected patients' populations (precision medicine, cell & gene therapies, rare diseases) linked to educational topics for internal groups and EU ecosystems. 

The Polish Association for Good Clinical Practice, GCPpl consists of around 1.000 members from pharmaceutical and CRO companies, medical doctors – investigators, lawyers, study coordinators and pharmacists from research sites. On the whole, it includes all those who embrace the idea of conducting clinical studies in accordance with the highest international quality and ethical standards of medical care and innovative therapies for patients.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
BioPharma First Consultancy offers education, training, business M&C services in areas of Biopharma (CGTs/ATMPs), Innovation and Regulatory/Policy.  In addition, she provides consultancy on topics related to OPEV, technology assessment, market analysis, industry insights, target selection, business models, strategy characteristics and enterprise valuation:

● Strategic and business advisor for selected Start-ups/Scale-ups (BPs, SPs, SI, RA, MA)
● Supported executive TMTs conducing to SBG (partnerships, investment funds raising, product dev, re-branding)
● Strategic and scientific advisor for VC/PE investors (healthcare/pharma), facilitating intuitive & rational investment decisions
● Business and product dev advisor for OTC medicines/medical devices (lidocaine transdermal formulation) related to regulatory and scientific insights (parts of eCTD dossiers)
● Advisor on registration activities and transfer of procedures/adoption of EU registration standards for a customer operating in the animal health therapeutic area in South Africa
● Advisor to a CRO on diagnostic tests used for patients with infectious diseases in terms of EU/US market analysis by applications, technology & suppliers
● Advisor to a CRO on modern therapies used in oncology including PARP inhibitors, benchmark analysis, products on the market, products in portfolio pipelines 
● Established new business relations with Pharmaceutical/Biotech companies, CROs, CDMOs & other consultation agencies (Pharmacovigilance, Market Access, Market Intelligence, Marketing/Communication) in the Netherlands and abroad (10+)

BioPharma First is registered under the KvK number: 68490305
profile_positions.title: Strategy & Business Consulting CEO

profile_positions.description:
ACHA is a non-profit organization made up of Latin American countries that connects them with different parts of the world, creating regional and global ecosystems in the Health Area in order to generate positive social impact through innovative solutions.
ACHA-Americas Continental Health Alliance's mission is to promote, encourage and support collaboration between Europe, the Americas and other continents so that each human being’s life finds balance and general well-being.

https://acha.ecosistemas.health/en/
